reviews: Typical amber off-red tint in the glass with a nice persistent 1cm head. Citrusy, piney nose with a hint of passion fruit. Smooth in the…

Bière 33 cl achetée sur une petite mousse lors d'un déstockage de dates courtes, elle était preque offerte. Robe dorée, belle mousse crémeuse. Un nez typé IPA avec des notes de houblons, d'agrumes, sur un fond résineux. Bouche fraîche, et fruitée, forte amertume. Une bonne IPA bien que je els aime un peu plus exotiques que ça.

Aspect orange limpide avec mousse résistant sur le verre. Nez sur le fruité : orange, fruits oranges, pêche. Bouche douce en entrée, épicée, fruitée. Goûts de fruits confits, de citron, d'orange, de résine. Finale sèche amère en diable mais néanmoins sucrée/caramel. Originale

Bursztynowa barwa, delikatnie opalizujące, dość trwała piana. W aromacie trochę liczi, trochę cytrusów i wyraźna nuta karmelowa. W smaku tego karmelu jest, niestety, więcej, ale, o dziwo, piwo nie sprawia wrażenia przesadnie słodkiego. Nasycenie średnie, goryczka średnia.

Robe ambrée, assez trouble. Mousse faible, nez fruité de houblons aromatiques, et un côté grillé léger en deuxième nez. En bouche, attaque très amère, à la fois sur le houblon et le grillé. Si ça a l'air bien mené, ce ne sont pas des arômes qui me plaisent plus que ça, et ça atteint un seuil d'amertume qui devient critique pour mes pauvres papilles.
From a bottle. Cloudy with little head. Nice refreshing fruitiness to it initially, then decent balance between bitter and sweet

AR: Litschi, Marmelade, kräuterig, Pflaume, leicht holzig, Rote Grütze, Zitrus, warme Milch
AP: trübes bernstein
TA: Marmelade, Pflaume, blumig

Bue en bouteille au Trappist (Caen 14000)
Nez fruité qui porte fortement sur le fruit de la passion.
Jolie robe orange trouble avec des teintes de blond pâle.
Mousse fine.
La bouche apporte principalement le goût juteux du fruit de la passion, ainsi qu'une sensation douce de bon jus d'ananas et une fine amertume de pamplemousse.

Pint draft at the 1965 Craft Beer. Appearance of the pour in an American pint glass is a hazy dark orange amber, topped with a finger of white froth, which recedes quickly to a thin ring and is not easy to regenerate. Aromas are muted when cold, as it warms, faint notes of citrus emerges, and on warming further, caramel malts are detected. But this is not a great one for aromas. Taste is malty, caramel, sweet, with an intense piney bitter, which is enhanced by the lack of any fruity hoppy sweetness. Medium bodied, maintains its texture well.

Robe orangée opaque, pas de mousse, belle amertume, nez floral et gout agrume.

J'ai toujours eu peur de son nom : peur non fondée
En IPA i den tunge ende, den smager fint af humle af den amerikanske type, er også lidt mørkere i det, med lidt karamel

Ein Bier, das irgendwie aus einer anderen Zeit kommt. Als das Bier rauskam, war es im Vergleich zu den klassichen IPAs recht bitter. Inzwischen gibt es aber allerlei Imperial IPAs, die mehr reinhauen.
Doch finde ich es geschmacklich voll ok. Grasige und hopfige Aromen dominieren und harmonieren gut. Nicht zu übertrieben und gut zu trinken.
33cl fles. Helder licht amber kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur is citrus en tropisch fruit. Smaak is zoet, karamel, citrus en gras. Medium lichaam, weinig koolzuur.

Robe blonde orangée, trouble à froid. Faible tenue de mousse. Arômes agrumes, fruits exotiques, résineux, caramel, un peu madérisé. Goût résineux, agrumes, réglisse. Sèche en bouche. Carbonatation très fine, moyennement abondante.
Bon, classique.

Robe dorée, belle mousse crémeuse. Un nez plus typé IPA avec des notes de houblons, d'agrumes, de lime, de fruits exotiques, sur un fond épicé. La bouche est fraîche et fruitée, ronde et équilibrée, la bulle délicate et la finale raffraîchissante. Une délicieuse IPA de soif.

On tap @Ølfred - Aarhus Streetfood.
Pours orange, with thick white head.
Scent: A bit fruity.
Taste: High bitterness, heavy for an IPA, malts, caramel.
Texture: Medium to low carbonation.

0,33l bottle from Alko, Iso-Omena, Espoo. Hazy orange beer with good and quite stable head. Aroma has sweet malts, honey and pine. Taste has malts, sweet honey, pine and hints of fruits. Bitterness is there at the end. Good balance, but not so fruity one.
Pours cider orange, good egg white head. Aroma of pale malts, orange and hop green. Taste of same with bitter bite in finish. Overall well balanced IPA. A bit of orange candy across palate.

F: medium, tan, good retention.
C: gold to amber, hazy.
A: malty, fruity, bit citrus, floral, bit tropical fruits, orange.
T: malty backbone, orange, tangerine, bit herbal, tropical fruits, dry on the palate, blood orange, nice hoppy finish with caramel touch, medium body and carbonation, nice one, enjoyed, 35,5 cl bottle from Cora Woluwe-Saint-Lambert in Brussels.

Bottle, 0.355l. Cloudy copper pour, lots of visible carbonation. One finger frothy off-white head, low to medium retention. Thick lacing on the glass. Caramel malts and pine on the nose, juicy citrus notes.

Thin to medium body, medium to high carbonation. Prickly mouthfeel, average texture. Moderately bitter taste. Aroma is nicely balanced between herbal and fruity characters with caramel malt serving as the backbone. Hints of vanilla and pine. Nice juicy citrus aftertaste. Slightly peppery, a bit dry. Mild alcohol presence throughout the finish.

Overall, nicely balanced IPA. Refreshing.
Slightly haze orange color with big thick white head. Light malt with fruity hop aroma and some light herbal notes. Silk, light bitter and slightly dry taste.

Bottle@ Wikas Rogue tasting w Senior. Appearance: pours muddy orange with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: bread, light caramel, apricot, peach, tropical fruits, oranges and floral notes. palette: strong us hoppy aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, balanced by a medium to notable bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: more balanced than brutal IPA

Fra fad.
Ravfarvet med hvidt skum.
Frisk aroma af humle, citrus og malt.
Blød og rund med en bitter kant. Velbalanceret og letdrikkelig!
Pours dark orange hazy color. Citruses, caramel a light earthiness. Taste is not as sweet as expected. Medium creamy body, medium bitterness.
Pours from the bottle murky amber with sizable cream colored head, cheesey aroma, bitter, piney taste

Der erste Eindruck ist kräftiges Malz und fruchtig, bittere Grapefruit. Wenig Kohlensäure und auch sonst typisch India Pale Ale. Der Abgang bleibt trocken, bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml can shared at За разБИРАчи, Ruse. Pours hazy with a thin froth and mousse head, heavy lacing, no visible rising carbonation. Golden colour. On the nose, citrus, driven by orange, with notes of boiled pumpkin and carrot. In the mouth, fizzy due to high carbonation, bitterness from the first sip, flavours of faded citrus with notes of honey and caramel malts, light texture and not mouth-filling due to bitterness, leading to a short bitter finish. Overall, possibly a bad bottle, but pretty ordinary for an IPA.
Solid, west coast IPA. Not much of a citrus bomb, especially in comparison with NEIPAs, Pine,  malt, some citrus and strong bitterness will get you satisfied.

Delicious taste.
Solid aroma.
Definitely would have again.
Stays on palate a touch long though
In der Nase sehr sehr grasig, zudem leicht Zitrus. Auch im Trunk sehr grün, Zitrus, alkoholisch, leicht Malz, hinten bitter.
A beer that seems to be made by mass consumption. The beer is fine but I have found a standard beer, without any appeal that makes it different. M has left quite indifferent. The best, the tag.
De geur valt mee voor een ipa. Donkere kleur. Weinig schuim. De smaak is echt enorm slecht.

Original Review in 2010- I like this beer a lot. Really haven't had a Rogue's that I didn't care for yet. I haven't been buying beer from this brewer recently because I find them rather expensive and trying new things, but I must say that they are still one of my favorites. Only bought a single to sample, but even at $11-12 a six I may buy this again. Has a medium cloudy yellow-orange appearance. Smells bitter with citrus hops. I also think this resembles more of an IPA versus ESB. Can't wait to sample again so that I can compare it to my favorite IPAs.
I love this beer one of my favorites my only complaint is in the afterbite stays on the palate a lil long

Botella 0,355l Ambar color,espuma blanca,mediana,fina,media resistente.Aroma cereales,citrico,caramelo,galletas.Sabor- malta,cereales,citrico,caramelo,frutal,fino amargor,lupulo, muy complicado para describir todo.Buena
Bottle from the Hop and Barley, Lincoln. Amber colour with an off white head. Aroma citrus and hard fruits and toffee. Taste light sweet to long bitter, with a big bitter finish. Medium body.
(orange, nez fruité berga-orange jam, crystal-hop, bouche-hop, soyeuse (blé), all nickel, citric-dosé, > sapin, mandarine)

Cerveza de color naranja nublado con una espuma blanquecina bastante buena. Aroma a lúpulo con notas de cítricos, de caramelo y de pino. En el sabor encontramos todavía bastante lúpulo, acompañado por una dulzura de cítricos, la malta, las agujas de pino y el caramelo blando. El acabado es marcado por una amargura media. Una India Pale Ale no tan brutal sino muy agradable de beber.
herbs, citrus, pale, golden, orange, brown, sparkling, minimal head, white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter,

Flasche 0,355l: Bernstein, orange, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische + sehr fruchtige Nase, kräftige fruchtige Süße, exotische Früchte, Mango, Maracuja, Malz, Karamell, süßliche Hefearomen, kräftige Hopfennoten; frischer + fruchtiger Körper, angenehme fruchtige Süße, Malz, Karamell, Hefearomen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, Zitrusnoten, Grapefruit, Grapefruitzest; angenehmer fruchtig-würziger Nachgang mit Hopfenaromen

0,355l bottle from Beer Republic. Pours hazy golden color with medium head. Aroma of citrus, hops, malts, caramel. Taste is a bit more sweet and grassy. Moderate bitterness with medium minus body. Aftertaste is a bit more bitter, but not in a balanced way.

Mousse Blanche qui ne résiste pas, couleur orangé. Arôme fruité sur les agrumes. En bouche, une belle amertume sur un fruité agrumes, fruits exotiques. Un classique US pas exceptionnel mais dans une très bonne moyenne. Je conseille ce choix pour se faire les papilles sur l'IPA. ///35.5Cl chez WBS

It’s brutality is not like a brutal dismembering, but closer to death by a thousand cuts. In a horror movie, it would be in Saw, not Texas Chainsaw Massacre 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From a 22 oz bottle into a chalice. Pours semi cloudy amber gold with head and lace. Aroma of floral hops, pale malts, straw hops, funky fruit zest. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of melon rind, straw hops, grains, minerals, pale malt, caramel. Overall rich, flavorful...somewhat challenging but decent.

(Bottle) Pours hazy amber brown with good slightly off white head. Nice aroma of stone fruit and toffee. Great palate - medium body with good carbonation. Great taste too, and not brutal. There's a very good backbone of sweet toffee malt. This is overlaid but a combination of hop flavours from tangy stone fruit to bitterness. Nicely balanced.

From Dec 2005

Poured from bottle(room temp) with a quickly diminishing head.
The beer is a cloudy medium gold.

The smell is a wonderful mix of hops and malt...you can just about taste the beer from the aroma alone and you *know* it's gonna be good.

The taste is a wonderful balance of the sweetness and bitterness with the hops taking over in the aftertaste and leaving me wanting more.. That's how drinkable this brew is. A *must* try if you see it in your local store.

Bottle from Pivný raj. 
Hazy amber with white head. 
Sweet hoppy aroma. 
Taste is mixture of hops, bitterness, something sweet and coffee beans. Good.
Bottle at home. Cloudy orange color, white head, looks good. A good ipa, with a good taste.

Аромат очень насыщенный хмельной. Во вкусе хвоя, цветы, манго, очень сложный вкус с умеренной быстро проходящей горчинкой. Выглядит жиденько но во вкусе хорошее охмеление. Намного лучше всяких punk ipa

il malto esce già al naso di prepotenza, insieme a fiori freschi. Crosta di pane subito al palato poi spazio al dry hopping. A occhi chiusi e naso chiuso pare una stout. Palato quasi pieno, alcol non spinto e quel poco coperto maluccio

Citrus (orange) and apricot jam notes in the nose. Feels sweet. Taste is sweet, like the smell, yeasty and with caramel notes. Grassy hops, bitter herbs. Medium bodied, dry, bitter finish. Too sweet, but nice nonetheless.

Bottle. Pours hazy brownish amber with medium white head. Aroma is malt, yogurt, grapefruit and spruce. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is light oily with soft carbonation. Finish is long and mostly bitter with notes that follow the nose.

Flaska bishops Örebro. Gulorange vätska. 
Mustig doft av torkad frukt, barr och citrusskal. 
Relativt tung maltig smak med barr, citrus och övermogna äpplen. Fyllig munkänsla med bra beska.
Pours golden with a medium sized white head. Aroma has citrus and hops. Taste is quite different with oak, caramel and citrus. Quite nice.

Dark brown, cloudy colour and a frothy tan head. Aroma has light hops and some malt. Taste has strong hoppy flavour, bitter, somewhat dry finish. Medium, soft carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Very nice overall.
Vähän vaisu. Odotin tuolta panimolta enemmän. Sellainen "ihan ok". Jos joku muu ois parempi.

Hazy golden color with creamy white head. Nice aroma of hops, malts and grapefruits. Taste is mainly hops with some grapefruits. Fairly bitter, leaves quite thin. Overall not so brutal as the title says, expected more. But very solid and easy going IPA

Ipa de 6,3 % abv, avec 5 malts : deux rangs, carawheat, c 15 dare et risk. Houblonnage en alluvial
en production propre chez Rogue. Le ebu semblerait être de 46, mais me semble un rien plus haut.
Mon exemplaire était à 6 mois avant date, et pourvu d’une étiquette sur fond rouge.
Couleur doré aux reflets ambrés, et à la clarté nette.
Bulles fines, partout, nombreuses et virevoltantes.
Mousse blanc cassé, épaisse, plus ferme en haut, stable à 6 mm.
Arômes de superbe fruité, précis, avec pointe de zeste, bon malt cara.
1ère bouche souple, à la très belle entame malt/fruit/résine.
Arrière-bouche dense, parfaitement équilibrée.
2ème au remarquable ensemble, avec juste la petite pointe de zeste adéquate.
Arrière-bouche longue, complexe.
3ème au très beau fondu des saveurs, avec une touche de tabac blond.
Arrière-bouche à l’harmonie très personnelle.
Longueur au superbe prolongement, avec des feuilles de hêtre, zeste de pamplemousse, pointe de
foin coupé.
Jambes fines, denses, assez collantes.
Levure douce, fruitée, très belle ligne (Pacman).
Alcool parfait, il contrôle tout : saveurs, équilibre, harmonie.
Finale prégnante, forte, très belle.
CONCLUSION : cette bière est un superbe dosage, sur une très belle recette, avec des ingrédients
hautement sélectionnés, souvent en production propre. Pas brutale du tout, mais superbe oui.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu IPA-lasiin tummankultaisena ja sameahkona, noin kahden sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksu on reilun kukkainen, mentholmaisuutta, havuakin on sekä reilu keksinen maltaisuus pohjalla. Todella mieto tuoksu. Maku on mallasvetoinen, keksisyys on vahvaa. Humalointi tuntuu lähinnä puumaisena ja ruohoisena ollen yllättävän kevyttä. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen miinus, katkerot kerääntyvät pikku hiljaa kuivattaen suuta. Olipa erikoinen olut, kaikki aromaattisuus on jäänyt johonkin Atlantille. Todella miedon makuinen ja tuoksuinen olut, oikeastaan aika harmiton, mutta aika paljon enemmän odotin. Suutuntuma on oikeastaan parasta antia.
Bottle 33cl. Pours hazy orange with a small white foam on the top. Aroma is grapes and hops . Medium body, active carbonation.Taste is pine, orange ending with bitter grapefruits.07/17
From elcervecero. In Teku glass. Playing Bastion. Light sweet fruityness with a strong (yet not brutal) bitterness, but more english than american, with an odd flavor, maybe mineral-like

Partagée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans des verres "Straffe hendrik".La robe a une belle couleur orangée surmontée d’une fine mousse blanc cassé peu persistante avec une faible carbonatation.Le nez nous offre rapidement des arômes d’agrumes: pamplemousse,orange......avec des notes houblonnées typiques des IPA. La bouche est à l’image du nez avec une amertume assez prononcée("brutale"!) dominant l’ensemble. Une bonne IPA,agréable mais qui manque un peu de caractère!13,5/20.

Partagée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre "Straffe Hendrick".
Température de début 6° environ.
Belle robe orangée translucide surmontée d’une fine mousse blanc cassé peu persistante; faible carbonatation.
Nez agréable sur les agrumes : pamplemousse ,mandarine, oranges.
Le goût est conforme à ce que l’on attend d’une IPA avec des saveurs houblonnées et fruitées.
La finale nous laisse comme prévu sur des notes amères.
Une IPA classique qui manque tout de même d’un peu de relief.
13,5/20

One of the most balanced IPAs I have tried. Orange colour. Moderate carbonation. A bit of citrus flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid hoppy IPA. Citrusy, bitter. With some cone aroma, herbal. Not so brutal but delicate imo.
Bottle. Pours clear golden. Floral, fruity, grassy, bisciut, bread crust aroma. Fairly bitter.
Achetée à Carrefour. Bière ambrée au nez fleuri et houblonnée. Très sèche en bouche, très maltée. Bonne bière mais ne ressemble pas aux autres IPA.

Sur un marché inondé par les IPA, dur de faire la différence. A l’ouverture la Brutal nous amène les mêmes arômes bourrins de houblons citronnés que l’on retrouve dans toutes les IPA actuelles, forts parfums de fruits tropicaux. En bouche cependant elle contrebalance cette puissance par une amertume douce et un houblonnage appuyé mais tout en légèreté, sans nous défoncer le palais. Corps moyen qui vient donner ajouter de la cohérence au profil de cette bière. Jolie couleur cuivrée. Une IPA faite pour ceux qui n’en peuvent plus des IPA.

Pours a huge thick foamy head and has a slightly cloudy orange/coppery appearance. Nice dirty lacing. Aromas of mild floral hops and much stronger citrus hops. Light grapefruit notes it seems as well. Flavours are strong in orange and grapefruit, some light grainy and barley malts also come into the mix and much hops. Orange flavour becomes stronger after a while and more grapefruit becomes apparent in the finish, making it lightly soured. Mildly spiced. Nice and smooth creamy mouthfeel. Full bodied with quite active carbonation. Not sure why named Brutal IPA (what is on the bottle), seeing as how ibu is not extremely high and a 6.5%abv count is not super strong. But oh well, still good tasting!

Oct 17 : Bouteilles achetées à Carrefour. Bonne ipa assez fruitée. Bonne donc, à regouter!
Juillet 19 : en vacances à Bidart. Bonne en effet, pas commune.

Bottle. Not perfectly fresh. Amber color with off-white head. Aroma has pine, needles, fruits. Taste is malty with long bitter aftertaste. Flavors of malt, pine, needles, citrus. Well balanced malty IPA.

9 mois avant DLC. Ambrée sans mousse ni carbo. Arôme fruits exotiques. Très belle rondeur ! Maltée, très houblonnée. Amertume prononcée top avec hamburger maison et frites. Tres sympa mais pas belle !
Toffi, karmel, trochę papai, potem cytrusy. Fajnie się pije. Piwo nie zadziwia i prawdopodobnie dla mieszkańca Polski nie jest warte swojej ceny.
650ml bottle. Pours orange gold with a great head. Mango, pineapple, savoury biscuit, little drying citrus. Very sweet, nice bitter finish. Good full body. Tasty.
Bottle. Light amber look. Foggy. Medium sized head. Aroma: nectary malts, fruity hops. Similar taste. Medium bitterness. A bit old still good.
Es war spät, ich war das erste mal im BEER TEMPLE in Amsterdam und ich war mal wieder aufgeregt ;). Trink ich irgendwann nochmal....bis dahin: IPA...JAAAA...Great but not the Best :). TAP.

6.2%. Hazy pale amber/honey. Medium head with high retention. Aroma intensity 3.75/5. Honey (flowers), cooked vegetables and alcohol in the nose. Unexpectedly brutal in the mouth, heavy sterile bitter. Quite pleasant. Light to medium body

ES una Ipa muy suave, poco de brutal, si es buena pero suave..el aroma no termina de ser lupulado, o al menos no excesivo. En boca destaca lo compensada, es bastante redonda. Predominio de fruta madura

Very nice IPA, the Americans definitely make the best ones. This one doesn’t smell flowery or thick at all, but it tastes very subtle and soft almost. Aluring beer that quickly makes you order a second, better than a lot imperial IPAs as well.
Na zdrowie, Salud, Kampai, Prost, Skaal, Zivjeli, Fenékig, На здоровь& Na zdravi

bottle @ home
hazy orange, cream orange explosive head
cream, toffee, butterscotch, sweet red orange, pink grapefruit, papaya, light hiops
cream, butterscotch, good hoppy bitterness, outmeal, farmer, grapefruit, wild strawberries, meringa, peach and orange juice

Not as brutal as expected. The body is medium for an IPA. The aftertaste is very bitter and a bit malty, as expected. Some interesting floral and citrus notes on the nose and the palate.

More balanced than the name suggests, but overall a very enjoyable IPA.
Cloudy, light brown, touch of pepper, orangeysweet, citrus, pineapple, malty sour aftertaste.
Botella 33cl del 3er tiempo Santander. Wow! Ipa robusta y contundente. No demasiado gruesa y con largo final. Con cautela.

355ml bottle at home on 2 Apr 2017, from Drygate Bottle Shop, Glasgow, floral, toffee aroma, golden amber with a very short-lived lively thin head, burnt caramel, toffee, citrus hop flavour, oily, fizzy, bitter hoppy aftertaste.

355 ml bottle. Bought in a Jumbo Supermarket in Santiago. Dense golden color with perfect thick head. Fruits and pepper smell with strong hops, tipical ipa; less smelly maybe. Good first strike, with sweetness. Miss a little more flavour in the end, but is still excelent.
Bottle@Salling Super, Aarhus. Pours golden amber with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, citrus fruits, caramel, citrus, orange. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Bitter finish.
33cl bottle purchased @ Monoprix.Belle couleur orangée, arômes d’agrumes. Amertume légère.

0.33l bottle. Hazy golden with medium good lasting white head. Aroma. rich aroma of tangerine, passion fruit, pine. Taste: candied fruit, caramel, biscuit, citrus, slight touch of warming alcohol. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Moderate bitterness packed with fruitiness.

Serving: from bottle purchased at Rogue Distillery and Public House.

Aroma: moderate pine hop.

Appearance: average-sized, frothy, off-white head. Fair lace and mostly diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-yellow body.

Taste: lightly bitter initial flavor and finish with average duration.

Palate: medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: easy to drink.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown (BBF 06/2017). AROMA: oxidized aroma with notes of dried grass, cheese and stale malt. APPEARANCE: light ambar color and cristal clear. medium ivory head with medium retention. TASTE: similar to the aroma with notes of caramelized malt and dried grass. medium bitterness with an almost dry and medium bitter finish. PALATE: medium-light body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: a beer to be re-tasted.

Pleasantly surprised by the Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar, I obviously chose this one with some expectations. Well, it’s a good IPA indeed, but this is not my favorite style to begin with. A fresh and hoppy taste, not way different from the best IPAs on the market but still enjoyable. Some bitterness quickly dissipated and a pretty correct aftertaste in mouth. Not my usual cup of tea but good enough to be APPROVED BY TAVERNY’S BLACK METAL CREW!

0.33 l bottle from Boxbeers.dk . Pours orange-ish, with a small off-white head. flat. Hop aromas, fruity, light raspberry, citrus, malts. Sweet, no bitterness. Flat, medium body, soft carbonation, abrupt finish.

Bottle, 12 FL. OZ. Pours very cloudy deep amber/orange with half a finger of soapy off-white head which doesn’t stick around long. Patchy lacing, moderate amount of visible carb; small bubbles. Nose is malty, sweet, fruity. Strong caramel, sourdough bread, candied pineapple and orange/blood orange, other tropical fruits around the edges and nicely balanced out by fresh, floral, citrus-y hops. Taste is similarly fruity and sweet, but also with a noticeably sharp grapefruit-y sourness as it hits the tongue. Turns sweeter and slightly syrupy towards the finish with some more juicy fruit (orange, mango) and sourdough malt. Some chalk/mineral bitters right at the end. Finish is long and wet a moderate lingering hoppy bitterness, with some cereal, light spice and white pepper. Body is solid medium and despite the slight syrupy character this doesn’t seem as sticky as some claim, instead going down super smoothly for me. Moderate carbonation adds a bit of extra refreshing sharpness. Great stuff with an excellent sweet/sour/bitter balance; not quite the juice monsters of your Cloudwater and "New England style" fare but a fine fruity IPA.
orange beer with a small white head. Floral, fruity aroma. Limited carbonated. Taste almost smoky, a bit sticky even. Not my thing.

Botella en 99Cervezas. 
Color dorado-ámbar, muy brillante y perfectamente transparente. Buena espuma ligeramente tintada, bastante cremosa con burbuja de diversos tamaños y muy adherente, aunque de persistencia media. En este caso no es un problema, porque permite ver casi enseguida un bonito encaje de Bruselas. Una preciosidad de cerveza. 
En nariz intensidad media y complejidad media-alta. Lo primero que viene es el lúpulo, acompañado de notas frutales, como de ciruela blanca no demasiado madura. Notas florales suaves pero presentes. También encontramos notas ténues especiadas, como de pimienta, así como el picor de la de hierba recién cortada. Muy ligeros toques de caramelo. 
El amargo y el luce compiten como sabor principal, ambos suaves pero muy expresivos y muy muy bien equilibrados. 
En cuanto a la sensación en boca, es de peso medio-ligero, suavemente frizante y con gran carácter refrescante. 
El fantástico equilibrio entre dulce y amargo se mantiene conforme evoluciona en boca. En el dulce, salen notas ligeramente amisteladas. El amargo por su parte, conjunta delicadeza y expresividad. El final en boca mantiene el equilibrio dulce-amargo, Sin que el primero resulte empalagoso en absoluto ni el segundo cargante. Un portento de equilibrio. 
Una cerveza maravillosa. De trago largo y extrema bebestibilidad. Tan sólo le cambiaría el nombre, ya que con el título de “Brutal" quizá muchos amantes del lúpulo extremo esperarán encontrar un fuerte carácter lupulado (aún mejor si es de lúpulo viejo), y no es el caso en absoluto.

Bottle from Boxbeer.dk
Short off white head. Cloudy golden color. Plesent hoppy aroma. Fresh hoppy taste with a mild maltiness and crisp body. Lingering bitterness that is medium level.

IPA avec un IBU de 46 et un titrage alcoolique de 6,7 % Abv. Cette Rogue Nation n’est pas si brutale que cela. Mais vous pouvez tout de même répondre favorablement à l’appel de cette bouteille qui vous interpelle avec ce "Join Us" fièrement inscrit sur l’étiquette. En effet sans être une grande IPA, notamment par son manque de complexité dans les arômes, elle reste d’une bonne homogénéité avec une longueur appréciable et des arômes agréables. Le peu d’effervescence déconcerte tout de même en verre, les très fines bulles permettant tout juste de napper la bière d’une mousse blanc cassée. Sa robe, blond vénitien (EBC au environs de 28) lui va à ravir cependant. Le nez quant à lui nous transporte dans une forêt de conifères. Celui-ci, intense se porte principalement sur les résineux, avec toutefois des touches de pamplemousse, d’orange et de caramel. A la dégustation, l’attaque est souple. Les arômes de caramel et d’abricot prédominent mais une arrière bouche citronnée permet de lui procurer de la fraîcheur. La seconde bouche est relativement suave et fruitée : fraise, ananas et orange sont au programme. L’amertume arrive alors, tranchante sur des arômes de pin et de pamplemousse. Le final sera long, mais n’apporte malheureusement aucune nouveauté et manque cruellement de variations... et frustre quelque peu. Dommage, car l’arrière bouche sur les fruits exotiques et le caramel accompagne convenablement l’amertume (l’arrière bouche aurait tout de même pu être un peu plus poussé) et l’équilibre est bien trouvé. Même si elle n’est pas "brutal", les 6,7 % Abv portent également bien l’ensemble et laissent convenablement s’exprimer les arômes. En définitive, on veut bien se joindre à Rogue Nation, mais un soir suffit tout de même.

Saporita, beverino, scivola benissimo e disseta.

Very drinkable and a complementary 6.3% ABV. Maybe a bomber of this next time.

355 ml bottle bought at The Q-Club in SoHo, Central.



Looks: Translucent golden orange colour with a ring of dirt-like yeast particles; Razor-thin head and residual white foam which fades in 10 seconds; Very small sticky lacing with quite fizzy small carbonation. 



Aroma: Very fragrant and sweet Ale malt, with strong orange, strong floral, honey, marmalade, pine, citrus and yeast. 



Taste: Strong sweet Ale malt, with strong citrus peels, marmalade, caramel, carbo, strong molasses, strong resins, biscuits, light yeast, strong lemon, very strong bitter hops and sharp grass.



Body: Medium body. Thick and oozy palate.



Mouth Feel: Very good Ale maltyness in a rich and very slick background. Quite strong caramel followed by a combo of strong jammy fruit peels and almost syrupy honey sweetness, but well balanced by strong resin ooze and fair pine. Fair biscuit and strong lemon to round. Immense and very pleasant!



Hoppiness: Strong orange, strong floral, jam, pine and citrus in nose. Strong citrus peels, marmalade, strong resins, strong lemon and strong grass in taste; Bitterness is very strong for a lasting, very high astringent sweet-bitter finish.



After Taste: Fairly dry. Sweet oozy and strong bitter to mouth.



Comments: Brutal? This one? Not really. Intense is a better word: Poor head aside, just about every aspect is strong and impressive, from bright colours, jammy aroma, sweet oozy taste, and strong lemony hoppiness. The sweet bitter combination are polar opposites but work just fine. Just love that orangey fruityness. A joy!
Slight haze develops on the pour. The flavors of subtle citrus, rich malt and floral hop match the aromas. Very nice amount of bitterness on the finish. I’ll definitely drink this again.

Awesome grapefruity aroma... some fruity esters... only the slightest smell of pale malts.

Nice low/medium mouthfeel.... relatively low carbonation... larger than average bitterness... with mouthcoating oily citrus hops... enough malts to balance

the aroma is fruity and, a little bit, caramel with hints of pine, orange, grapefruit, toffee and spicy herbs... the taste is malty and fruity with notes of sweet orange, grapefruit, pine needles, toffee and spicy grasses... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

Blonde dorée, légèrement trouble, mousse blanche moyenne qui ne tient pas trop. Nez floral, ananas, fruits exotiques, fraise. Attaque amère, saveurs de fruits tropicaux et quelque peu de fruits rouges. Le corps est moyen, la longueur bonne et l’amertume persistante. Bonne IPA, exactement ce qu’on attend d’une american IPA !

Ambrée claire voilée, nez houblon floral, bouche sur une amertume prononcée, notes agrume, finale sur pointe sèche persistante. Bouteille 35cl achetée chez Monoprix Montparnasse, Paris, France, bue le 04/03/2016.

On tap at na 7.schode, Zilina. Pours is cloudy amber with big creamy white head. Aroma of pine, resin, fruity, lemon and spicy. Taste is light to moderate sweet, moderate bitter, silid malty background, resin on tongue. Medium body, slick to sticky texture, light bitter finish.
Une bonne bière IPA qui note des goûts fruités d’agrumes. Rien d’exceptionnel, une bière comme j’en ai déjà bu, mais je me suis régalé.

12oz bottle from Beer Cartel, Sydney. A clear Amber with a small and fading light beige head on the pour. Aromas of peach, pineapple, lychee and hop leaf. Sweet-accented to taste with distinct pine and grapefruit characters to finish. Good malt heft. Mid-weight, soft to medium carbonation and a moderate length and intensity finish.

12 ounce bottle from the brewery in Issaquah
Appearance: light amber, hazy and cloudy medium head, lacing
Aroma: Hoppy and malty-strong smell of grains
Taste: very good, hoppy bitterness and very good follow through
Palate: Medium-full body, very nice, sticky creamy, fizzy, strong bitter finish follow through
Overall: very good beer, good to repeat
Drank: March 17, 2016
Happy St Patrick’s Day

Hazy orange color, minimal white head. Earthy aroma, fruit, hops and mango, same taste. Soft carbonation, medium body. Long bitter finish. Nice. //bottle, as Rogue Brutal IPA, bought at Graz craft beer festival
Pours a hazy orange amber color with aroma of citrus and pine. Citrus flavor with caramel, biscuit, and pine. Touch of bitterness. Nice beer.
Типичная ИПА. Есть отголоски Рога, как такового. Хорошо заходит, есть тело, есть послевкусие.

Bottle. Golden color with medium white head. Aroma is citrusy, hoppy, floral, strong orange, zesty, caramel. Taste is strictly balanced, dominant hoppiness with caramel, floral and zesty notes, full body, medium sweet with long hoppy bitter finish. Nice one
maltosa a sufficienza, sentori di pompelmo e decisa con l’amaro anche nel finale, ci sta

Pours hazy orange Amber with a foamy yellow white head that fades kinda quickly to a rim, coating and lacing. Aroma is caramel malt, jammy citrus and floral hops. Taste largely follows - loaded with juicy citrus flavors. Orange, lemon, a bit of grapefruit. Some closing hoppy bitterness that blossoms with warming. Very dry on the palate. I really like this IPA - could be a go-to beer.

Bottle at home from Beer Hawk. Mostly clear orange / amber coloured pour with a lasting loose off white head. Aroma is chewy, caramel malts, orange rind, some biscuit, hints of pine. Flavour is compose of semi-sweet, caramel biscuity grains, orange, tangy, hints of earth and maybe a little pine. Palate is medium bodies, semi sweet, highish carbonation, little chewy. DeScription says "A non traditional ipa" But this is now tasting decided old school.

A beautifully balanced IPA. I was expecting something very challenging based on the name and on the brewery’s well-deserved reputation for pushing the envelope. There’s a great mix of lemon, grapefruit, lime, sherbet, musk and cherry. The grapefruit and cherry are prominent on tasting, as well as toast. A really enjoyable experience.
Na, so brutal ist das Piwo auch nicht. Dafür recht blumig, frisch und hopfig. Daneben leicht in der Frucht und moderater Bitterkeit. Nicht schlecht.

The beer has got a hazy golden-amber colour with a smooth body and steady head. Aroma of hops and biscuits. Taste of hops, pine, spruce, herbs, flowers, blossoms, spices and biscuits. Hoppy-mild bitter finish. Enjoyed it.

Slightly hazy brilliant golden with a thin foamy white head. Aroma has some lemon and orange rind on the nose with a bit of a piney bitterness. Nice mellow flavor with a strong pale malt body, kinda overrides the hoppiness, with a lot of grassy and light earthy lemony hoppiness. Mostly earthy biscuity malty.
Aroma has hint of bread and citrus. Slightly bitter hoppy taste with long finish. Beer is very cloudy and has nice golden color. Minimal head. Overall I liked this IPA a lot.
Pours hazy amber with thin white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, caramel. Taste is sweet, malty, with light bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation.

Pours hazy orange-brown, with medium head with some yeast on top. Aroma is hoppy, slight citrus notes and very fresh. Taste is very full, medium carbonation with a slight sweet feel, leading to an excellent bitter finish. A very well balanced IPA, which is not too brutal in dryness.
On tap. Orange with off white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, grapefruit, orange. Sweet caramel flavour with long bitterness

Fruity citrus on the nose, some pine. Nice deeper orange color, with a huge off-white head. RIch sweetness up front. Huge malt backbone. Caramel, bread up front. Bitteness creeps in slowly. Not too strong....expected a bit more bite. Pine, some pepper. Balances sweetness nicely. Medium, rich mouth feel. Nice finish, bitterness echoing down the hatch. Solid IPA.

Alaranjada turva, espuma amarelada de boa formação e persistência. No aroma notas bastante cítricas, laranja, limão, pessego, muito bem equilibrada a ponto do malte ser perceptível. 
Paladar novamente cítrico, de leve dulçor e médio amargor. Corpo médio, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste mantém as impressões do aroma, notadamente cítrica, bem balanceada. Muito bem feita apesar de estar próxima da validade e ter perdido parte do frescor.

Citrus rind aroma, hops are clean, not earthy or muddled at all. More lemon in the scent than anything else with some peach added in as well. Light orange color with a long lasting pure white head of foam. Taste has a citrus rind punch right away, again it is a lemon/peach combo, very unique. Not much sweetness in the background, but it also does not come off bitter. Very drinkable and refreshing. So-so palate, but it matches the light nature of this beer. I don’t know why this is called Brutal; iti s not overly hoppy at all. Good IPA, I have had better, but this is easy to drink.

Bottle@Home.
Appearance: clear orange with off-white head.
Aroma: c-hops, medium malt.
Taste: citrus, medium sour bitter.
Palate: smooth, medium body, low carbonation.
Overall: very nice.
Mesmo não sendo muito fã das IPA, essa é muito boa mesmo. Amarga e cítrica na medida certa
Bottle. Hazy caramel with foamy dissipating head. Batting zero tonight. This one smells kind of off too. Sweet and peachy. Not getting amy good hops. Just tastes old. Boo grocers and bottle shops.
A nice and smooth drinkable IPA, but the hoppy tones were too weak and in my opinion not outspoken enough to make it a truly great one.

At Maakun’s. Bottle from Gall & Gall. Fruity orange sweet sugar orange tea with lots of sugar. White raisins. Dried dusty apricot. Sugary sweet with over moderate bitter. Body is medium to full, carbo is low, texture is oily, grainy. Finishes quite nice and round. Pretty nice, could be fresher I guess.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Slight hazy amber with off white head. Caramel, lychee, dried apricot, some peach, cardboard, light herbs and some curry, light grains. Almost medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with a bit slick feel. Seems a bit old.
Apricot aroma. Good! orangish color. Well balanced, no brutal aftertaste. Hoping for a bigger mouth feel but didn’t get it.

Ambar, no mucha espuma que dura poco. Potente aroma resinoso lupulado, citrico, fruta tropical. En boca es menos brutal de lo que anuncia el aroma y el nombre. Base dulce azucarada, y frutal mas que brutal, algo de pomelo amargo, pero bastante más melocotón. Equilibrada, muy sabrosa. Final bastante amarga al final.
citrus, resin, with light color. bitter aftertaste. Big bottle great for sharing.
Hazy gold with a thin-medium white head. Aroma of fruit, citrus hops, sweet malt. Sweet with a light bitter finish. Thin oily texture, low-medium carbonation.
A marmalade and tropic fruit full of aroma, a supremely well balanced ipa, that manages tropical sweetness and hop bitterness.
A non-traditional India Pale Ale with big citrusy, hop flavor and intense hop aroma. Medium-bodied with a vibrant lingering hop-bitterness that is anything but brutal. Enjoy!
Amber with a medium white head. Aroma is oranges, pineapple, grapefruit, caramel, bread. Same in taste. Bitter aftertaste.

Fantastic IPA. Pours a deep dark translucent orange with an off-white head that dissolves into a ring. Somewhat reserved, fresh hoppy aromas. The taste begins grapefruit-hoppy and moves into sweeter, marmalade-like notes. Solid body with a fine carbonation and a modest hoppy aftertaste. Wonderfully drinkable.
Aroma cítrico, ótimo primeiro taste com retrogosto persistente. Ótima IPA. Bem equilibrada

Nez: Agrumes, fruits tropicaux
Bouche: Caramel, pamplemousse, ananas, pin, amertume douce qui reste longuement en bouche avec une sécheresse 
Une très bonne bière bien fruitée mais légèrement aqueuse sur la fin
Lys orangebrun klar med lavt hvitt skum. Fruktig lukt, røde bær og fersken. Lett søtlig smak, fruktig, medium bitterhet. Godt balansert.
Muddy brown color with foam layer. The smell is heavy and sweetish hoppy. The taste is well carbonated, and sweetish hoppy with a thick calm mouth feeling and aftertaste.

6-pack of bottles from Molly’s Spirits. Orange to amber in appearance. Aroma of grapefruit, zesty hops, toasted grains and yeast. Medium hop bitterness with a light malt sweetness. Medium body with a yeasty finish. A little rough and kind of hard to drink overall.

Alla spina. IPA bionda, frizzante, erbacea e amarognola. Le note "esotiche" e fruttate sono più deboli di altre cugine americane ed emergono al loro posto più robusti sentori di cereali, fiori, malto e luppoli dal profilo "europeo". Particolare e robusta.

650ml bottle into shaker. As ’Portland State IPA’. Smoky malt nose, hoppy background. Translucent orange colour appearance with creamy white head with good lacing. Steady and fine carbonation. Slight zing, oily texture. Gorgeous hops complemented by creamy malt background. Finish is short and subtly fruity. Really easy drinking for 6.3%! Nice.

Smells delicious of tropical fruit papaya mango pineapple with a nice citrus hop finish. Taste starts off real multi followed up by a nice hobby tropical fruit finish does not linger on the tongue Crisp quick clean finish love this beer by rogue keep making the great bruise you do can’t wait to try more.

It is a nice troubled copper I.P.A There is of course the side bitter. The hop is here, there is a side sweet, a perfect wedding between the cereal and the hop and dry. Drinking this beer in a train from Geneva to Delemont. I drank again this beer today at home. The thing that I could say is that the final note is watery but it is enjoyable, the carbonation is rather low for a IPA. It is easy to drink, thin and white foam.
Not bad at all. Mild IPA with moderate hops bite upfront giving away to smooth palate. Poured from a bomber to a glass. Good all day IPA
Drank with Rik 21-11 in Malden while playing Machiavelli. Fine beer, a bit peculiar hop taste. Not very exquisite but okay.
Pours a hazy gold/light orange with virtually no lace and moderate carbonation. Aroma of citrus hops and malt. Taste is malty, citrusy, and not as bitter as expected.

Pours a cloudy golden brown on tap with thin wispy white head that leaves light lace. Aroma is nice citrus hops, but kind of muted, taste follows, a bit oxidized. Think this keg may be old, but I can tell it’s former glory.
Received from beerhawk and very happy with this IPA. Hoppy but not too much, and quite refreshing.

12 oz brown bottle into a snifter glass. It poured a hazy orange amber colour with beige foam, short-lived but with lasting lace. Great hoppy aromas and flavours of sweet citrus, melon, pineapple, dank resin. Struck me as a blend of Columbus and Crystal, with some Southern Hemisphere tropical notes mixed-in. Intense, but not harsh. Definite bitterness, but not overwhelming. It seems I love these Rogue Alluvial hops. Hefty caramel maltbill underneath, but not so complex as to compete with this hops-forward balance. Light-medium body, moderate carbonation, lingering hoppy aftertastes. Extremely tasty.

Pours copper with a huge foamy head. Actually the aroma is something new for me, it smells like a combination of orange juice and pineapple juice, very nice indeed. A bit thin, some fruity pineapple notes and a slight bitter finish but too watery. Certainly not brutal.
Bottle @ the enck.... small medium white head... opage orange amber colour.... smell yeast grassy malts... taste yeast grains malts... good carbo soft body...
Copper colour with a thin white head. Modarate intensive aroma, intensive hoppy flavour with notes of pine! Long bitter aftertaste. @craftbeerstore

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: 12 ounce bottle, poured into IPA glass. 
Appearance: Cloudy golden orange with a good one inch head. 
Aroma: Hops galore and good. 
Taste: Wonderful hops through and through. 
Palate: Thin and slight carbonization. 
Overall: Pretty good no complaints at all.

Botyle tallboys beer market Leeds. Orange ok head. Aroma is sweet citrus caramel taste same good malty backbone nice sweetness good hoppy bitter finish good balance of flavours. Nice mouthfeel prickly carbonation. Good stuff.
Geweldig aroma, licht fruit.. citrus.. nog redelijk subtiel allemaal.. fantastische smaak ook, uitgebalanceerd bitterzoet met een dikke dikke fruitige afdronk

Pours a hazy orange-gold with a low head. Some lacing. The aroma is fruity and piney hop notes, a little flowery. Not as lush or fresh feeling as others in the style. Tastes good though, a strong citrus front, backed by decent malt and pine. Has a pretty gentle mouthfeel and a mild bitter finish. Begs you to take another sip. Solid.

Tropical fruit and pine on the nose, along with an aroma of sweet malts. Tastes flowery and piney, with grapefruit and more tropical fruit. A nice, if unspectacular, West Coast IPA. Considering the use of English malts, it is a rather good hybrid IPA.

Copper/orange with a one-finger off white head and modest lace. Aromas of floral hops and light fruits - mango, pear, peach. Flavor follows, with floral hops most prominent. Light body, moderate carbonation, sticky mouthfeel and a slight bitterness in the finish. Doesn’t live up to its name.

From draft. Poured a slight hazy dark golden to more orange colour with a slight white head on top. Nose has tropical fruits, grains, crisp malts, mango, and stone fruits. Slight long lasting bitterness with a small taste of caramel. Medium bodied mouthfeel

12 oz bottle from Total Wine and More The ale poured a cloudy light amber with a smallish head and no head. The nose detected citrus and pine. This is a nice IPA with a soft palate yet a complex blend of various hops. The medium body ale has average to soft carbonation. This is an ale that finished dry and smooth with a tinge of bitter citrus..

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 05/2016 Pours deep cloudy orange amber liquid, small stable frothy head, Aroma: grapefruit, pine, citrus, litchi, honey, flowers, Taste: medium, sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sour, fruity, grapefruit, citrus, pine, sweets, litchi, orange, tangerine, Palate: medium body, velvet creamy texture, soft carbonation, long citrus bitter aftertaste, Overall: extremely drinkable, and tasteful IPA, enjoyed. One of the best I ever tasted.

Bottled 355ml. -from Pivoljub Ljubljana. Cloudy pale golden coloured, small off-white head, touch of honey and caramel in the nose. Sweet malty, caramel, hops, notes of honey and fruits with mild dry nutty finish. Pretty ordinary.

Poured a translucent murky brown with a few millimetres of white foam that quickly diminished to a collar that laced OK. Carbonation low and medium sized. Aroma subtly of citrus plus sweet malt. Taste slightly malty with a nice moderate bitterness. Light body. Soft, light, with a lingering nice moderate bitterness on the finish. Not really "brutal".

Hazy orange color with medium white head. Lots of floral and herbal hops, also citrus and a malty backbone. Taste follows the aroma, floral and grassy, with citrus fruits and caramel. Medium bitter aftertaste.

Jolie couleur cuivrée avec une mousse blanche fine et assez tenace 
Honey on va sentir des arômes d’agrumes de poivre d’épices
Un bouche on va commencer par sentir un début d’amertume qui devient au final très doux et passe tout seul en bouche on va toujours sentir ses notes épicées et quelques notes de confiture d’écorce d’orange amère 
Bière assez sympa
Loved this IPA, perhaps my favorite one of the Rogue Nation. Very nice fresh citrus like fruits in it’s challenging hoppy aroma.

schenkt amber met gelige kraag. aroma van mouten, zoet, citrus, gras, floraal en mooi hoppig. Smaken zijn redelijk zoet, redelijk hopbitter, sterk, goed moutig karakter van ambermout, gras, lichte den, bloemenhoning, floraal, gist, medium body, glad van textuur, lage co2, bittere afdronk.
Bottle at home, orange beer, small head, aroma is hoppy, malt, taste is the same, nice... easy drinkable beer

Orange colour, with a head that fades leaveng a ring and some lace. Smell of tropical fruits, pepper, pine. Medium body, great carbonation. Taste of resin, tropical fruits, caramel, pepper, there’s some sweetness there too. Good.
Hazy orange amber color with small lasting head. Aroma is citrus, malt, caramel. Flavor is malt, fruity, bitter, caramel. Well balanced IPA.

355 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange-tan with a thin but lasting white head. Aromas of pine, biscuits, caramel and grapefruit. Taste starts off with some malty sweetness before a firm pine resin and citrus bitterness washes through. Some lemon, pepper, mint and caramel at the end. Enjoyed this one.
Горечь во вкусе не слишком заметна, она более выражена в послевкусии. Довольно мягкий солодово- хмелевой вкус
Bottle. Clear orange color with white head. Aroma - Tropical fruit, caramel, pine. Taste - Bitter, fruity, candy, hoppy.

Dense, irregular yellowish cream head over well-carbonated, fully hazy orange beer: shards of lace; Sweet, cake & rosewater, orangepeel. One can guess the hospe, but this is not a hoppy nose. Let alone brutal... Oranges, orangepeel, dry hops (especially retronasal). Bit grassy, too. Nice, suggested sweetness from the nose is held quite in check. Medium bodied, quite slick, well-carbonated. Nose misleads - the rest is more than decent.

35,5 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Gall&Gall, Tiel.
Hazy golden/amber with a white head. Tropical fruit aroma with some pine and some malts. Good bitterness. Solid IPA.

A bit on the dryer side. Lots of piney hops. Medium bodied beer, very good. Try it if you are standing and the beer store getting nervous about what you should try. Just try it, you won’t be disappointed.
Bottle at le melting pote in Nantes. Golden color with a small white head. Fruity aroma with a touch of caramel. Bitter ending. Medium to full body. Very nice

Bottiglia @ Milano Beer Week. L’intensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva discreta. Il cappello di schiuma a bollicine fini produce un bel pizzo sul vetro. Anche la frizzantezza è a bollicine fini, con carbonazione insistita. La consistenza del liquido è opalescente, dal colore ambrato. L’amaro è moderato. Il corpo è rotondo. L’intensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è godereccio. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di amaro. Il finale è felpato e amarognolo. Il retrogusto è intenso.

Pelo aroma já se percebe que é uma ótima cerveja. O nome brutal passa a impressão de que é uma cerveja forte, mas não é. Muito equilibrada. O amargor domina com uma dose de malte fazendo um fundo. Uma das melhored IPA que já provei.

Draught at Delirium Hoppy Loft. Very thickly lacing, towering, frothy and dense, egg-white head, cloudy amberish orange blonde robe. Strong bouquet of orange peel, caramel candy, kiwi, pineapple, pink grapefruit, wet paper, toasted pine nuts, chicken broth, bitter honey - complex, perfumey and sweet, a bit unusual for the style. Soft tropical fruitiness in the onset, peach, kiwi, strawberry sweetness, orange, medium carbo with a smooth, slick caramelly maltiness, aromatically hoppy finish, spicy, blood orange ’citrusness’, bit peppery but in all soft and much more aromatic than deeply bittering, letting a lot of juicy maltiness pass. Soft, rounded, ’tropical’ IPA, very interesting.

20-09-2015, Scheveningen.

Wat een lekker IPA! Zeker een aanrader. Mooie oranje kleur met een zoete geur. Perfect qua smaak en bitterheid. Prikkelt lekker op de tong!
Bomber from Old Line. Nice copper body with big head. Nose is hoppy, with cactus and pine. Taste is hops aplenty, bitter, floral with oranges in there. Really nice. Well done.

From the tap, the pour is auburn with a medium thin white head that lingers, the aroma is citrus, hops, but not overpowering, the taste is initially bitter, then hops and vanilla with a citrus finish, the second drink brings in malts, and the finish is hops and a little bitter. The mouthfeel is medium.
Amber with medium white head. Dry, partly citrusy, sourness mixed with moderate bitterness.

Heavy aroma on this. Mid range color and very cloudy. Mildly bitter start and finish. Pretty clean overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

resin, spruce, golden, amber, lightly bitter, bitter, medium body, average carbonation. Almost worrisomely bitter aroma, but nicely balanced sweet and sour in taste. The slightly bitter aftertaste compels you to take another drink; very drinkable.
Das Bier hat 6,2%. Frucht, Zimt und Karamell in der Nase. Dunkelgelbe Farbe. Schaum zerfällt schnell. Malziger Antrunk. Dann kommt der Hopfen. Runder Geschmack. Bitterer Abgang.
Grapefruit in der Nase, auch im Geschmack dominierend, schöne kräftige bitternote

Bue en bouteille de 355ml chez le ki.
Couleur blonde mousse et effervescence moyenne.
Nez agrumes.
Bouche agrume mandarine. Fin de bouche pamplemousse. Continuité sucrée

A shimmering gold colour with a pale yellow head. The aroma is sharp and citrusy, giving you the expectation of a similar taste and it doesn’t disappoint. It is smooth on the tongue, sharp and slightly bitter, but citrusy and fresh, leaving a refreshing, clean feel.

Pours haze golden amber, with unstable white creamy head.
Aroma: alcogol is not noticable. Crystal hop give gorgeous aroma of tropical fruits (papaya, lychee, mango).
Flavor: taste is mouth feel, sweet, slightly bready, toast (reason is problably of cara wheat).
Body is soft, malt sweetness medium, hop bitterness also. Finish is dry, carbonation is low.

Dark copper beer, opaque with a nice bubbly head.
Smell is bitter citrus and pine, resin. Touch of orange peel. Cheese and cherries. Apple, caramel.
Taste is bitter with a hint of heavy sweetness. Warm orange with... egg? Nice full taste with a refreshing finish, subtle sourness.
Wow, i got the different hops, turns out it was a hybrid hops! Nice one this, hoppy but overwhelmed by the smoothness very fast. Very nice.
Taster at AEON Liquor. Mostly rich orange and caramel, herbal notes, a bit boozy, bitter finish. Fairly hoppy and drinkable, decent stuff.

Bottle at The Roebuck, Leek (Titanic) A hazy pale amber with a fizzy white head. Aroma is quiet sweet of wheat, caramel, some straw, orange marmalade, grapefruit, maybe honey and floral hops. Taste of orange marmalade, grapefruit, caramel, some wheat, a little honey, pine and slight floral hops. Medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A bittersweet, caramelly, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. It’s not brutal but it’s pleasant and really well balanced. Isn’t different but a good IPA
Bottle from Omihachiman Aeon. Really cloudy gold-copper, small head. Orange and caramel aroma. Tastes initially sweet from the caramel malt but the orangey hops give it a great bitter finish.
Piney, citrus taste. Almost oily texture. A hint of bitterness. Pretty average.

On tap at Beer Revolution. Pours a hazy amber colour with a tiny off white cap. Aroma is slightly grapefruity with a touch of B.O. Taste is slightly grapefruity with a bitterness at the end that reminds me of bile. I’ve had better IPA’s.

Decent ipa, but nonetheless annother "just alright " beer from rogue. Bitter, piney and somewhat grape fruity. 


Re-rate: Don’t know what i was thinking about - great IPA. Amazing prickly aroma - tons of peach, sweet tea and tangerine.
On-tap, this pours a hazy copper color with a slight head. The aroma is full of bitter hops. The taste is bitter, well-balanced with lots of great hops flavor.

Bottle from Mitsuya’s. Pours a clear orange-amber with a modest off-white head. Big orange marmalade aromas with some grapefruit and pine notes as well. Taste is more of the same with the orange really standing out. Good caramel sweetness present as well. Awesomely balanced but pretty straight forward IPA. Nice medium to light bitter finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a orange amber with a medium white head with some lacing. Aroma is of citrus pine hops notes caramel malt and yeast. Taste has citrus and pine hops bitterness, some mild orange notes, caramel malt and yeast, which intensifies as the beer warms up. Palate is a medium body with good carbonation. Finish is sweet caramel malt, yeast with a good amount of citrus hops bitterness, a mildly dry ending. Not too brutal as the name implies. Overall a very good, solid and tasty brew.
Bue en bouteille de 355ml. Blinde légèrement ambrée. Nez discret sur l'agrume. Palais bien houblonné, fines bulles légères. Longueur moyenne. Pas mal.

0.65 l bottle from P&M Getränke (6.2% abv). Hazy, reddish amber with a thin, soapy, slowly diminishing, white head. Fruity-resiny aroma of orange, honey, tangerine, pine and hints of grapefruit. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of orange, honey, tangerine, pine and hints of grapefruit. Short, slightly bitter finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, average carbonation. Not as brutal as expected, rather mild for an IPA. Still quite good but too malt-accented in my opinion.

355ml. Bottle. 

Pours clear orange with white head. 

Aroma citrus, pine, tropical fruits, caramel. 

Taste caramel fruity sweets, fresh piney bitter. 

Mouthfeel thin, dry. 

Good IPA.

Perfect amber pour w/ a retaining tan head that leaves a great ring of lacing. The aroma is a mild blend of hop & malt. The taste has some underlying bitterness but is nicely balanced w/ malt which makes this quite drinkable! The soft mouthfeel is rather unusual for the style but makes this one unique & overall an excellent ipa!

Bottle
Aroma-fruits,herbs
Appearance-orange, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

Hazy amber apeatance with small white head. Aromatic woth hops, citrus notes. Balanced bitter and sweet taste with malts and ftuits. Medium carbonation and 6.2%. Good beer but nothing " brutal" about it.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, zamglone. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości.

AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Mocno owocowy, cytrusy, akcenty żywiczne. W tle zboża.

SMAK: Mocne cytrusowe walnięcie na dobry początek. Posmak cytrusowy. Goryczka wysoka, zalegająca.
650 ml bottle. Pours a clear amber with moderate head. Aromas of caramel candy, dried fruit, and a bit of citrus and tea. Flavors of same with a dry bitter tea like finish.

Aroma: caramel, grass, floral, citrus, 
Appearance: clear light amber, off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy feel, soft carbonation, long finish

good stuff

Appearance was hazy orangish gold with creamy off white diminishing 1 finger head, spotty lacing. Aromas are bright tangerine, lemon, grapefruit with soft dill and toasty malt sweetness. Taste are tangerine, lemon, grapefruit upfront gives way to soft malt sweetness. The clean yeast profile lets the lemon hop finish. Palate was smooth soft CO2 with medium body, then lasting clean crispy bitter finish. Overall a solid clean IPA with some classic hops.
Fairly solid ipa...more Malty than hoppy...smooth finish....(#548).....................
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours golden amber. Nose is pine, sticky caramel and toffee. Taste sweet caramel, grass, pine, plenty of malts, apricot.
Bottle. Aroma is floral and citrus. Color is a orange gold that poured with a large frothy white head that leaves heavy lacing. The taste is malty with medium bitterness with minimal aftertaste.

12 fl oz. bottle. Orangey amber colour, foam white head leaving lacing and light aroma of fruity, slight mango, floral citrus, woody, hop. Taste is bready malt with mellow hop resins and woody spicy bitterness. Medium bodied, soft catbonation, dry earthy dusty bitter finish. Quite drinkable.
Aroma of spices & herbs. Cloudy amber with long lasting white head. Medium sweet & light bitter taste. Full bodied, creamy texture & average carbonation.
Slightly imbalanced IPA. Some hops, nowhere near as much as even the mildest Stone Ale. Not bad.
Frothy white head. Stone fruit and grapefruit in the nose. Medium body with moderate hoppiness. Just a standard middle of the raid, but decent PNW ipa

Bottle. Pours a bit hazy, nice amber, modest foam. Aroma is quite thick and malty, hops actually feel a bit faded. Which does not make the beer worse for me, but I guess it would taste a bit different when totally fresh. Taste is agressively bitter, malt body still dominating, giving the bee somewhat bready feeling. Aftertaste also having some long lingering bitterness. Good IPA, not too special or too amazing though.

Large Format - Cloudy orange color, big thick head when poured. Typical IPA smell, not very distinctive at all. Good hop flavor but not over powering or dry at all, not much bitterness either. Just a decent middle of the road, non-offensive IPA.

Hazy orange, with large cream head. Aroma is strong citrus and fruits. Taste is straight bitter, very hoppy, grapefruit, mango, peach. Very smooth, medium bodied and well balanced. A classic, good, IPA.
Soft amber pour, no real head. Nose is woody hops and malt. Bitter. Middle is soft fruit and malt interplay...subtle. Finish is solid, but restrained, hop bitterness. Not brutal, just delicious.

Bottle from Drinkmonger. Hazy amber body with a thin off-white head. Lively carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of caramel, green apple and orange. Flavour of sweet tangerine, menthol and pine needles. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Unlike the name suggests, this is quite a restrained IPA that’s high on drinkability.

330ml bottle, pours hazy bronze gold, with a foamy lasting white head. Aroma is malty, caramel and toffee, lightly hoppy, fruity and floral notes. Body is medium, texture is lightly oily, finish is long, bitter and dry.
Great reddish orange hue and dirty IPA and nice and balanced. Very nice beer indeed.

660ml bottle & keg @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours a deep amber with large white head. Sweet malt aroma. Taste follows with a sticky resin presence and pine. Some orange rind and caramel. Flavoursome and easy-drinking.

65cl bottle at cerveteca bar in Lisbon. It pours a bronze colour with a decent beige head that lasts. Aroma is green mango, hops, citrus and some bready notes. Flavour is slightly piney and citruisy, some malts and bread and an expected hoppy bitterness at the end. It has a low to medium body with light carbonation and a crispy feel. It’s a standard IPA, but I expected more flavour and richer aromas.
Solid India Pale Ale. A little malty. Hops a good blend of bitter and floral. Looks great too.
Tap. Pours a hazy golden with a layer of creamy head. Aroma and taste of pretty intense hops upfront mixed with some bread malts.

Rogue Brutal IPA has a thin, white head, narrow lacing, and a murky, orange appearance, with lots of tan, powdery sediment suspended throughout. The aroma is fruity (mango?), with a white bread note. Taste is the same, with mild bitterness and slightly-turned fruit. Mouthfeel is light to medium, and this beer finishes somewhat like a lager in its crispness. A tart ale. RJT

A cloudy orange amber color.
The aroma is minimal but fruity.
The taste is, well... Meh.
Overall a beer I wouldn't buy again.

BOMBER from Bov. Barely detectable hops in th aroma, quince gem, caramel, some sugar even, and of scourse caramel malt. Some unfresh notes too. tastes fruity and caramelish, moderte but harsh hops bitterness. Somewhat sticky.
Oranje geel bier met witte schuimkraag. Lekkere bittere IPA, niet heel uitgesproken van smaak, maar wel subtiel. Hoppig, bitter, grassig, de nasmaak blijft lekker lang hangen, bitter en grassig.
Rogue is a great brewery and this is a fantastic beer. It is medium in color and has a nice overall palate.

I love Rogue brewery and many of their beers. This is just ok. Nothing to really dislike, but nothing that will blow you away either.

This beer was very mellow for an IPA it poured light and had a very light head. The beer lacked on that final IPA hoppy notes and didn't carry well through the pallet.

Poured from bottle gold with a off white head. Aromas of pine and sweet citrus. Taste is crisp with overtones of citrus caramel and a nice hop finish.

Pours a cloudy pumpkin/bronze with an off white head and good lacing. Cardboard, fruit, floral, citrus aroma. Malty, bready, caramel, hard candy sweetness, bitter finish, citrus, fresh flower. Pretty tasty. Would like to try it fresh.

Pours a crystal clear gold with a mild white head. Moderate level of hop aroma which is vagely citrusy and floral with notes of pine. The malt charicter on the tongue is bready. The mid palate brings the hops with more pine and citrus. The finish is of sugar syrup and pine with a lingering bitterness and slightly astringent mouthfeel. This is an easy drinking, every day IPA.

Très belle petite IPA que la Brutal! Celle-ci est bien moins brutale que son nom peut laisser croire. Est-ce un défaut? À mon sens, pas du tout! Cette bière, sans être complexe ni de classe mondiale a tout d’une petite bière agréable et sans prétention que l’on peut facilement boire tous les jours et en toutes circonstances. Le nez est floral, frais et un peu fruité. Ça sent le printemps mais sans être herbacé. Je trouve qu’elle sent presque les vêtements qu’on laisse sécher sur la corde à linge. La mousse semble généreuse mais celle-ci est éphémère, laissant les parois du verre presque sèches et sans dentelles. Dommage. En bouche, le houblon est présent. Mentionnons toutefois qu’il ne s’agit pas de l’explosion classique de houblons américains à laquelle nous sommes habitués mais de jolis houblons qui sans redéfinir le style, nous ramènent aux bases d’une IPA franche et bien faite. De longueur et de corps moyens, sans arrière-goût particulier, cette bière se boit très aisément sur la terrasse!

Ambrée claire orangée, bonne mousse blanc cassé assez persistante.
Au nez houblonnage agrumes orange. Maltage assez présent.
En bouche caramel puis amertume avec l’houblonnage agrumes orange. Assez fruitée en fin avec belle longueur d’amertume. En finalité IPA très balancée.
Uit grote fles. Ruikt hoppig en citrus. Smaakt beetje zoetig voor een IPA, wel lekker maar iets te weinig bitter.

Crisp and malty, thoroughly enjoyable brew. Gives a nice fruit flavour and the hop bits through. It was nowhere near as "brutal" as I was expecting, so from that point, I was a bit disappointed, but it was delicious.

35.5cl bottle at Beer is Food, Singapore on 04/04/15. Cloudy orange colour, medium carbonation with a nice white head. Sweet aroma if citrus and pine. Oily mouth feel, bittersweet, citrus first followed by pine / hops. Not the best IPA I have had.

Look: pours a light gold. Slight haze. Bright white head. 
Smell: grapefruit. Orange. 
Taste: grapefruit. Lemon. Orange. 
Feel: extremely dry. Heavy bitterness. Thin mouth feel. Leaves a thick film on the mouth.
Overall: ok beer. Have to like bitter. 
First drank: home 3/31/15
Vintage:
Murky orange pour with the healthy white head. Piney aroma. Front end taste has lots of resin and citrus flavors, with a bitter aftertaste. I would buy this until the end of time.

hazy. Light grainy malty, bit autumny leafy pine woodsly nose. Sour oranges, real bitter, almost astringent finish. Lots of flavour. Not that smooth though. Dark caramel, bitter herby. Had better, drinkable still.
355ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy golden orange with a thin white head. Citrus fruit aroma with pine. Sweet finish. Very nice.

Couleur ambrée, bonne mousse blanche. Nez fruité, agrumes douces et malt. Gout houblonné, fruité/agrumes en marmelade, malté, note caramel avec bonne amertume zeste d’agrumes en fin de bouche. Bon corps. M’attendais a plus sur l’amer et le houblon. Pas mal
Pours orange with white lacing. Big hops aroma with citrus. The hops are so well crafted, belies the name. Nice finish
Draught @ NYC Craft Ber Festival. Cloudy pale yellow with small off-white foamy head, doughy aroma, citrus peel taste, low carbonation, long hoppy finish. Not a great IPA.

660 ml bottle

Murky orange beer with little off-white head. Aroma and flavor have cream fudge, caramel, resin, peach and some catpee. Does not seem very fresh. Palate is full with moderate carbonation. Finish has quite heavy bitterness. Aftertaste is caramelly and fruity with stinging catpee like bitter taste. I’m sure this would be better when it was fresh.

Hazy orange body, medium sized white head, and soapy lacing. Papaya, grapefruit, orange rind, mild sweet perfumey malts. Medium bodied with moderate to gentle carbonation, semi-dry throughout, moderate bitterness, clean finish.

Bottle at home after dissapointigly having to miss a To Ol event I managed to grab a few bottles to sip in consolation. Pours hazy orange with big tropical fruit nose. Tastes of pineapple, grapefruit, passionfruit, caramel, earth, pine, and banana. Sweet yet bitter. Smooth palate. Quite nice I havet had a Rogue beer in a long time but this is lovely.
On tap. @El Cabanón, Avilés 07/03/2015. Aroma afrutado, Color cobrizo. Sabor afrutado y maltoso.
Tap from Stone's (hop leaf anniversary). Orange cloudy pour. Aroma is super biscuity. Taste is very very bready malty - piercing orange hops though. Bitter finish. Not bad.

Draught at Stone's. Very cloudy (almost opaque) bright orange-brown. Smells of woodsy hop and caramel malt, toffee, bread. Tastes of earthy piney woodsiness, orange, caramel malt. Very malt forward but goos mix of maltiness and hoppiness, very orange-y, fresh tasting.
Quite a nice IPA. Hoppier and more bitter than the 46 ibu would suggest. Aromatic piney some sweet citrus. Nice IPA. Impressed.

Pours an opaque golden orange with a nice meringue like head. Aroma is of peaches oranges and apricots very nice. Flavor is bitter ripe Orange with an amaretto like touch a nice gentle bitter aftertaste. Médium palate full of flavor yet easy to drink

Cloudy amber with a decent head. The aroma has pine, grass, citrus as expected. Taste is initially honey, tangerine, grapefruit, then the grassy and pine hop bitterness kicks in. Medium bodied and fairly smooth. Very solid IPA.

Not as Brutal as the name implies. I get sweet malt on the nose, barely any hops. The taste is sweet and malty like Dead Guy, but not as flavorful. Hops are minimal in my opinion. Very good but not great.

Hazy, amber beer with an almoust one finger high head. 

Nose: Apricot, dried fruit, mandarine, pine, citrus and floral hops. 
Taste: Orange marmelade, citrus, pineapple, peach, grass, caramel malt and honey. 
Body: Medium body with crisp carbonation. A light bitterness at the end that stays on the tounge. 

This is a great IPA!

Aromat ogromnej ilości różowych grejpfrutów, landrynek, mango. Barwa bursztynowa, klarowne. Piana ładna, drobna, długa. W smaku zielone grejpfruty, cukierki ślazowe, pełne, ale i orzeźwiające. Dobra grejpfrutowa goryczka.

IPA di Rogue offre forti note agrumate ed erbacee all’olfatto mentre al palato, dopo un inizio fruttato, emergono i toni di scorza di limone e arancia. Nonostante il termine "Brutal", questa IPA non è particolarmente aggressiva grazie al bilanciamento tra l’intenso luppolo e la mordibezza e pienezza del corpo.
Bottle a cloudy dark golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy citrus fruits some yeast and hops flavor malts spicy citrus fruits yeast and a bitter hoppy aftertaste

22 ounce bottle poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a hazed copper color with a big white head of foam. Good retention. The aroma is pine, citrus zest, some lime juice. The taste has moderate bitterness, some citrusy sweetness, and a dry floral finish. Just a little peppery. Medium body and low to medium carbonation. Slick mouthfeel.

Aroma:
Apricots galore, plums, dried fruit, raisins.

Overall: Wow, the aromas on this are ones you could just sniff by the hour. Strong apricot with dried fruit. The flavours aren’t quite as spectacular but this is still a very good IPA overall.
Subtle aroma. Slightly hazy appearance. Taste grapefruit and delightful strength. Again subtle strength and hit on the palate. One that could slip up on you very easily. Good.

The aroma is soft & subtle. Scents of fruit salad & fresh greens. The beer is golden & opaque, not cloudy but opaque. The flavour starts with a resounding taste of grapefruit. The bitterness & sourness of the grapefruit is balanced with a nice sweetness and herbal finish. The mouthful is silky.

Medium aroma with apricot, some citrus and hops. Golden orange color with lightly hazy liquid. Small white head. Strong but smooth taste with natural apricot, honey and hops. Medium aftertaste. Medium body with average/soft carbonation. Overall very soft and tasty IPA with some own character.
labelled Portland state IPA. Pours golden with a big pillowy head. Citrus (lemon/orange) aromas, tart, sharply bitter and finishes quite dry.
Pours a hazy amber/orange with a creamy head. Nice mango and citrus aromas. Aromas continue in the taste. Very juicy mouth feel, yum. Slightly bitter finish. Good IPA.

2014 bottle. Pours a bright orange copper with an off-white head. Aroma is biscuit and grapefruit with a slight brininess. Taste is the same with more of a sweet malt flavor with a little caramel and an earthy pine bitterness that's floral at the end. A little aspirin like. A nice medium mouthfeel that is more tannic than dry.

Half-pint on tap in Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury on 12th Jan 15 before the monthly bottle exchange. a little murky light amber/bronze in colour. Thin white head that tried to last. The nose was semi-sweet, biscuity malts, with a fruity hop undertone. The taste was hops to the fore with the maltiness in the aroma now taking second place in the flavouring. Nothing brutal about it: nice blend and a fine beer. Good bittering finish.

Deep hazy dark orange color with small head. Aroma of hops, but not too dominant, a bit citrus, a bit pine, also caramel. Smells like Zopf or Brioche. Taste is caramel, but not sweet, hoppy bitterness is very present, but not really fruity. Decent bitter finish. Smooth carbonation. Tasty, but not too complex. A non-sweet but still rather malty interpretation of the IPA style.
Draught keg at the Head of Steam, Durham. ABV was 6.2%. Golden body. Medium white head. Tangerine, vegetables, dust, spice, hops, peach. Bittersweet. Dry finish.

On tap at SOT Bar & Burger, Trodheim. Pours hazy deep golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma is fruity malts, grapefruit and piney hops. Taste is light sweet malty, dried apricot and resiny hops, with traces of herbs and liquorice at the long finish, very good one.

Bottle. Poured cloudy, orange, with a small white head and some spotty lacing. Aroma of hops, tropical fruits, and resin combined with some caramel. Taste is hoppy, bitter with a caramel, malty background. Very nice; enjoyable and quite drinkable.

650ml bottle at home. Pale orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Pine, grapefruit, citrus, spices and herbs. A nice tasteful IPA.
Pours deep golden with thick white head. Aroma of pine and citrus. Tastes ofsame with a bit of well-hidden booze.

Aroma: Medium-light hops, tropical fruits. Medium malt, caramel.
Appearance: Hazy, golden-orange body. Small, rocky head, good retention.
Flavour: Medium-light sweetness. Medium bitterness. Medium light hops, fruity. Medium malt, caramel, biscuit. Medium dry finish. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium carbonation. 
Overall: Nothing brutal about this beer at all. Well balanced, enjoyable. 

650 ml bottle, poured. 
14A. English IPA
Mahogany pour, lots of white head. Aroma is light. Wheat, hops, malt, earth. Flavor is hopped up but not too bitter and still earthy. Medium mouthfeel. Clean and refreshing for an IPA.

650ml bottle. Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Just about clear, light bronze colour. Film of white head. Decent balance of sweet, toasty malts, and light, orangey hop, but I wouldn’t say it was brutal. Some grassiness. Slightly earthy. Taste has a light, malty sweetness, turning moderate bitter. Palate is a little oily, and quite smooth. Finishes light, long bitter. Very drinkable, but not one to get too excited about.

Slightly hazy orange body with a beige head. Aroma is malty, hoppy, citrus, some caramel, sweet grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet with medium to light bitterness. Light to medium body, long finish. Refreshing beer.

66cl bottle. Hazy orange colour with a very small white head. Citrus, caramel, mango, light pine and grassy notes in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is sweet upfront with bitterness coming after. Overall, a great beer.

Not much hits the nose from the glass but the taste is super. Got citrus, a bit of orange, mandarin. Some caramel malt maybe dash of honey halfway through. Doesn't smash palate. 650ml, 6.2%, 3.2std drks.

Hoppy and fruity aroma.
