Great IPA!

Big bottle, served in TeKu. Pours deep orange and golden with thick head. Aroma is suprisingly malty and I dont really get why Crystal would provide massive aroma as it is described. It doesnt anyway. Of course, there are some distinct hints of pine, some citrus, but nothing especially interesting. However, it is very well balanced with malts. Id rather expected stronger hops aroma. Taste is terrific, lots of matliness combined with caramel, toasted bread, biscuits well mixed with balanced bitterness. It does however have some peculiar flavour in the finish, I dont really know what that is. It remotely tastes like anise. Anyway, its a very good beer, not in the top league of IPAs, even classic, english ones, but worth recommending and trying.
Weak aroma of hops and citrus, cloudy amber colour, without much head. A very interesting taste of hops and fruit with undertones of apricot. Oily feel with a mildly bitter finish.

Pours a murky burnt orange, with a thick white head that settles down rapidly.
Aromas of citrus hops, and caramel malts. Quite well balanced in this regard.
Tastes start off citrus and turn to caramel malts in the middle of the process, as it flows over the tongue, finishing with a lemon zest tingle.
Overall, in a word, balanced.

You really notice the malts in this one. Pours a hazy amber with a frothy white head. Aroma is of pine, citrus, caramel malts, basement, and biscuit. Tastes of pine, citrus, caramel, peach and biscuits. Has a medium body with average carbonation and nice amount of bitterness. A very good starter IPA to introduce people to the style without crazy bitterness.
Una IPA estrema. Decisamente buona, con ottima schiuma, briosità giusta, al palato vengono fuori prima i malti e poi i luppoli, decisi, cattivi. Ottima persistenza ma non invadente
caramel, citrus, leaves, orange, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, bitter finish, medium body.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Amber colour with white head. Aroma is malty with background hops, some pineyness. Taste is unusual, malty, dark fruit, bitter, some dryness, again backgroundy hops. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Not what I was expecting. Interesting stuff.

A fine IPA from lovely Oregon. Herbal, resin hops, biscuit and caramel malts and some earthiness waft up from this coppery quaff, ivory topped, lacing champion. Beauty! The mix of hops and malts is unlike anything I have had before, it is funny they call it Brutal (although I love the name) since it seems more on the mellow side of hop aggression. It’s very balanced but the hopping and malts are not what’d you expect from the name and style. The body is great, medium and chewy with a great aftertaste of citrus and resin hops. Lots of biscuit malt flavour in here too. Maybe the brutality comes from being sneaked up on.

Bottle:
Clear, dark amber with a sudsy, off-white head.
Caramel malt, wood-polish scent.
Taste is earthy/nutty caramel malt....
I get the brown ale feel to it, but the hopping lends to a slightly chemical note.
Malty, wood and earth tones....
Just didn’t enjoy this.

Brutal Bitter: "bigger than your average bitter, which is nice, but i’m not sure if i a) don’t like the malt combination b) don’t like the hop combo or c) got an old one. i thought i remembered this beer being better, but i was sorely disappointed last night. not thin, but bland. smelled musty. "
A nice beer, the goodness underneath is overwhelmed by the malty taste of the brewn. Still a very good beer!
Not brutal at all, slightly sweet brown ale notes. Hops compliment the malts quite nicely, with some background bitterness. Easy drinker.

Un olfactif floral et herbacé. des notes de rose et de chèvrefeuille avec un soupçon d’épices et de résine de pin. des arômes très agréables et différents des grosses IPA houblonnées à cru. 
Le visuel est ambré avec une mousse épaisse et dense. Très persistante. De belles traces sur le verre. 
Le gustatif est tout en fleurs; de la lavande, de l’eucalyptus, des fleurs sauvages. Tout en subtilité. Pas du tout la grosse amertume des IPA américaines. Les conifères sont également bien représentés par le cèdre et le pin, et leur dosage est bien balancé avec les notes florales. En bouche, l’équilibre est juste à point, et la finale, assortie d’une légère sécheresse. Une excellente IPA. Les houblons sont d’une subtilité remarquable. On s’éloigne ici de la grosse amertume ’’west coast’’ et on s’approche un peu plus des subtilités européennes.
Poured from an enormous bottle at California Pizza Kitchen. Large frothy head well lasting. Sweet aroma, floral. Cloudy orange color. Acidic taste. Smells better than it tastes

Tap@kampela. Darker orange, hazy. Light grainy malty, bit autumny leafy pine woodsly nose. Sour oranges, real bitter, almost astringent finish. Lots of flavour. Not that smooth though. Dark caramel (almost barley winey notes!), bitter herby. Had better, drinkable still.

(Rogue Brutal IPA) Bottle 650 ml at home, poured into a tulip, ABV 6.2%
Mostly clear body, deep orange in colour. Small and thin off-white head, with okay retention, leaving light lacing on the glass.
Aroma is a bit weird, there is some citrus when I swirl the glass a bit, but the main aroma has vegetable notes and some biscuit.
The weird vegetable notes are following to the taste too, but seem to fade when the beer has breathed a bit. Biscuits, some orange peel, caramel and malts on the back. Mildly bitter aftertaste, nothing extreme or even above your average IPA.
Medium thin body, carbonation on the low side. Mild dryness on the palate.
Overall okay, didn’t meet my expectations.

IPA deserves a straight up pint glass, ha ha, hmmmmmm....let’s do this. 
The appearance was a slight burnt orange to brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute. There was some light lacing here and there all around and just glazing the glass in a nice adequate fashion. 
The smell had a light orange to glazed over tangerine sort of light and somewhat leading apricot to mango citrus wonderful aroma.
The taste was mainly sweet but still had a light decent bitterness that ended up having a slight bitter hoppiness all around. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation was there but still had a slight harshness but was still good for the most part. 
Overall, pretty good beer to have again.
